alert.note: Alert for City of Newport News; Gloucester; James City; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 23 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Newport News, Gloucester, James City and York. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 545 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Newport News, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Gloucester Point, Patrick Henry Field, Seaford, Lee Hall, Denbigh, Wicomico, Achilles, Fort Eustis, Yorktown, Harris Grove, Lackey, Newport News Golf Course, Hornsbyville, Oriana, U.s. Naval Weapons, Dare, Oyster Point and Ordinary. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: City of Newport News; Gloucester; James City; York
